intro: Phyllanthus fuscoluridus subsp. villosus, commonly known as the hairy false crossandra, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are alternate and have a rough texture due to the dense pubescence. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its unique appearance.
